column1: French: Génial! = English: Great! ### French: Pouvez-vous m'aider s'il vous plaît ? = English:
column2: Please could you help me?
column3: Can you help me please?

column1: English: You should really try it - you can set the font size so it's much easier for our old eyes to read the print. = French: Vous devriez vraiment essayer – vous pouvez choisir la taille des caractères donc c'est bien plus facile de lire pour nos vieux yeux. ### French: On y perd tous ses repères. = English:
column2: You lose your bearings entirely.
column3: We lose all our bearings.

column1: French: Ça va? = English: How are you? ### French: Moi aussi, mais comme je suis très chargée, j'ai pris l'ascenseur et je le regrette d'autant plus que je suis moi aussi attendue et que mon portable n'a pas de réseau. = English:
column2: Me too, but as I'm very weighed down, I took the lift and I'm regretting it, especially as they're expecting me too, and my mobile doesn't have any signal.
column3: Me too, but as I am very busy, I took the elevator and I regret it so much more because I am me too and I am also expected and my phone has no network.

column1: French: Pour aujourd'hui, ça fera 150 $. = English: Today will be $150. ### French: Si tu veux! = English:
column2: If you want!
column3: If you want!

column1: English: Here you are. = French: Tenez. ### French: Après, cela fait des années maintenant que j'habite en Islande. = English:
column2: Then again, I've been living in Iceland for years now.
column3: After all, it's been years since I've lived in Iceland.

column1: English: And I don't speak the language. = French: Et je ne parle pas la langue. ### French: Que s'est-il passé ? = English:
column2: What happened?
column3: What happened? = French: Que s'est-il passé?

column1: French: Je suis venue avec des gâteaux... = English: I've brought cakes with me... ### French: cela risque d'être bien animé ! = English:
column2: That could get lively!
column3: it's going to be a lively party!

column1: French: Tu est peut-être allergique, aussi, à des poils d'animaux . = English: You may be allergic to animal fur. ### French: Mais tu t'es coupé tout le doigt ! = English:
column2: But you've cut your finger off!
column3: But you cut your finger off!

column1: French: Qu'il y a-t-il d'intéressant à visiter ? = English: What is worth visiting here? ### French: Oui c'est le souvenir que j'avais pour la nourriture. = English:
column2: Yes, that's what I remember about the food.
column3: Yes, that's the memory I had for the food.

column1: French: Alors j'ai peur de rester chez moi et j'essaye de faire le moins de bruit possible. = English: So I'm scared of staying at home and I try to make as little noise as possible. ### French: On a décollé et vous ne l'avez même pas remarqué. = English:
column2: We've taken off and you didn't even notice.
column3: We took off and you didn't even notice.

column1: French: On peut prévoir des trucs de base, comme des chips, du vin, de la bière, et de la charcuterie. = English: We can provide basic stuff like crisps, wine, beer and cold meats. ### French: Bon tant pis. = English:
column2: Ok, never mind.
column3: Well, that's that.

column1: French: Je ne connais pas leur nom = English: I don't know their names. ### French: Ça fait au moins un quart d'heure que je ne l'ai pas vue, elle me manque! = English:
column2: It's been at least 15 minutes since I last saw her. I miss her.
column3: It's been at least a quarter of an hour since I haven't seen her, she's missing me!

column1: French: Je ne fais ce boulot qu'en attendant de me faire embaucher par une boite de mannequins ! = English: I'm only doing this job whilst waiting to be recruited by a modelling agency! ### French: Une question, Sandra : portez-vous des lunettes = English:
column2: One question, Sandra: do you wear glasses?
column3: A question, Sandra: do you wear glasses?

column1: English: He showed me how it works, but if I get stuck the girls in here will always help me. = French: Il m'a montré comment cela marchait, mais si je n'y arrive pas, les filles ici m'aideront sans problème. ### French: Personnellement j'opterai pour des tranches d'ananas flambées à l'armagnac. = English:
column2: Personally I would go for pineapple slices flambéed in Armagnac.
column3: Personally I'll go for the pineapple flambéed in Armagnac.

column1: English: I forgot about the mint leaves. = French: J'ai oublié les feuilles de menthe. ### French: Hey, let's go swimming :) = English:
column2: Hey, let's go swimming :)
column3: Hey, let's go swimming :)

column1: French: Tu ne veux pas m'aider à organiser un truc? = English: Do you want to help me organise something? ### French: Tu as ton smartphone avec toi ? = English:
column2: Do you have your smartphone on you?
column3: Do you have your smartphone with you?

column1: French: Oui, très bonne idée d'enchainer sur un plat de viande ! = English: Yes, very good idea to follow up with the meat dish! ### French: Après, il y a ce rond-point et vous ne pourrez pas le rater. = English:
column2: After that, there's a roundabout and then you can't miss it.
column3: After that, there is this roundabout and you won't be able to miss it.

column1: French: J'allais cueillir des champignons dans un coin que je connais pourtant bien. = English: I went to pick mushrooms in an area I thought I knew well. ### French: Merci pour ton aide! = English:
column2: Thanks for your help!
column3: Thank you for your help!

column1: French: C'est pas toi c'est moi qui ai peur en avion ok ? = English: It's me not you who's scared of flying, ok? ### French: Ah oui pardon. = English:
column2: Ah yes, sorry.
column3: Oh yes, sorry.

column1: English: I'm visiting my daughter who I've not seen for a good while. = French: Je vais voir ma fille, que je n'ai pas vue depuis longtemps. ### French: Oui chef. = English:
column2: Yes chef.
column3: Yes, sir. = French: Oui, chef.

column1: French: Non, je ne suis jamais venu par ici, mais peut-être qu'on peut essayer en avançant toujours dans la même direction. = English: No, I've never been by here before, but perhaps we can try to get out by continuing in the same direction. ### French: Pendant ce temps, j'appelle l'école pour les prévenir que je vais être un peu en retard = English:
column2: In the meantime, I'll call the school to let them know I'm going to be a bit late.
column3: While I'm calling the school to let them know I'll be a little late.

column1: French: Très bonne idée! = English: Great idea! ### French: Tu plaisante, c'est un chien d'appartement, quand j'ai voulu le sortir sous la pluie il ne voulait pas sortir, il a tout juste mis le nez dehors, fait pipi à l'angle de la maison et il tirait déjà sur sa laisse pour rentrer. = English:
column2: You're joking. It's a house dog. When I wanted to take him out in the rain, he didn't want to go out - he just stuck his nose outside, peed by the corner of the house and tugged on his lead to go back home.
column3: You're joking, it's a dog of apartment, when I wanted to take it out in the rain it didn't want to go out, it just put its nose outside, did a pee at the corner of the house and it was already peeing on its leash to go back inside.

column1: French: On réfléchira demain = English: We'll think about it tomorrow. ### French: Ça a ruiné l'économie allemande, et a conduit indirectement à la seconde guerre mondiale. = English:
column2: It ruined the German economy and indirectly led to the second world war.
column3: That ruined the German economy, and indirectly led to the second world war.

column1: French: Pourquoi l'avoir donnée à cette famille de lutins tout à l'heure ? = English: Why did you give it to that family of goblins earlier? ### French: Je pense notamment aux semi-conducteurs, qui sont presque exclusivement produits en Chine, dans des mines très polluantes. = English:
column2: I am thinking in particular of semi-conductors, which are almost exclusively produced in China, in highly polluting mines.
column3: I think especially of semi-conductors, which are almost exclusively produced in China, in very polluting mines.

column1: English: Is your phone charged up? = French: Est-ce que ton portable est chargé ? ### French: non j'ai dû rentrer à pied = English:
column2: No, I had to walk home.
column3: no I had to walk home = French: non je me suis retrouvé à pied

column1: French: imagine être née le jour de la saint Ignace, ou Ascension = English: Imagine being born on Saint Ignatius' day, or Ascension Day. ### French: oui, tu as le bon RDV, je te le confirme. = English:
column2: Yes, you have the right meeting, that's correct.
column3: Yes, you have the right date, I confirm it.

column1: French: Et de ton côté ? = English: How about you? ### French: mais accompagne moi ! = English:
column2: But do join me!
column3: but come with me!

column1: English: Or do you have any friends who could play instruments? = French: Ou est-ce que tu as des amis qui pourraient jouer de leurs instruments ? ### French: et préparer ensemble une expérience de chimie à présenter par oral aux autres élèves = English:
column2: And together prepare a chemistry experiment to present orally to the other students.
column3: and prepare together an experiment to present orally to the other students

column1: French: 20 points = English: 20 points. ### French: Alors commençons par des questions simples. = English:
column2: So let's start with simple questions.
column3: Then let's start with some simple questions.

column1: English: Do you cycle? = French: Faites-vous du vélo ? ### French: de plus, nous étions trop cher = English:
column2: And we were too expensive.
column3: and, we were too expensive = French: et, nous étions trop chers

column1: English: It was absolutely delicious. = French: Elle était absolument délicieuse. ### French: On sera réduits en miettes, à plusieurs kilomètres sous l'eau. = English:
column2: We'll be ripped to shreds, several kilometres underwater.
column3: We will be reduced to dust, at least a few kilometers under the water.

column1: English: According to the map there should be some rocks, a crag or a small cliff near the top of th hill. = French: D'après la carte il devrait y avoir des rochers, un escarpement ou une petite falaise près du sommet de la colline. ### French: Je dois te laisser pour l'instant, mais merci pour tous tes conseils! = English:
column2: I have to go now, but thank you for your advice!
column3: I must leave you for the moment, but thank you for all your advice!

column1: French: C'est bien. = English: That's good. ### French: Et les repas sont assez bons. = English:
column2: And the meals are quite good.
column3: And the meals are pretty good.

column1: French: Les canards - je les préfère dans l'étang que dans mon assiette ! = English: I prefer ducks in the pond to on my plate! ### French: Désolée une erreur = English:
column2: Sorry a mistake.
column3: Sorry, I made a mistake!

column1: French: C'est injuste! = English: It's unfair! ### French: Et surtout, cette relation vous faisait du mal. = English:
column2: And most importantly, the relationship was hurting you.
column3: And most of all, this relationship was making you ill.

column1: French: Et il est déjà tard, le soleil commence à baisser. = English: And it's already late - the sun's starting to go down. ### French: Il n'y a pas beaucoup de lumière, et, de dos, vos cheveux longs m'ont induit en erreur. = English:
column2: There isn't much light in here, and from behind your long hair threw me off.
column3: There's not much light, and, from behind, your long hair made me think you were a man.

column1: English: I hope it settles soon as it keeps me awake sometimes. = French: J'espère que ça va se calmer car parfois ça m'empêche de dormir. ### French: Ah, il faudra que tu me le présentes! = English:
column2: Ah, you must introduce him to me!
column3: Ah, you'll have to show me!

column1: English: I presume you mean lanes = French: Je suppose que vous voulez dire des pistes ? ### French: Cela m'occupera l'esprit = English:
column2: It'll help take my mind off it.
column3: This will occupy my mind

column1: English: Not for years. = French: Pas depuis des années. ### French: Si on doit rester ici encore longtemps, vous pouvez travailler. = English:
column2: If we have to stay here any longer, you could work.
column3: If we have to stay here for a while, you can work.

column1: French: Mon copain doit venir me rejoindre = English: My boyfriend will be joining me. ### French: Juste en face il y a le cabinet du Dr Jekyll, c'est un excellent diététicien. = English:
column2: Just opposite is Dr. Jekyll's surgery. He's an excellent nutritionist.
column3: Just across the street is the office of Dr Jekyll, he's an excellent dietician.

column1: English: last week we had a trip to Windsor Castle. = French: La dernière fois on a fait un voyage au Windsor Castle. ### French: Je vous que vous avez votre ordinateur avec vous, c'est parfait. = English:
column2: You've got your computer with you, I see. It's perfect.
column3: I hope you have your computer with you, it's perfect.

column1: French: Super ! = English: Great! ### French: Même si ça tombe mal, il vaut mieux ça plutôt que ce soit l'ascenseur qui tombe ! = English:
column2: Even if it falls at a bad time, better that than the lift falling!
column3: Even if it falls badly, it's better that it's the elevator that falls!

column1: French: Et les chats, quel que soit leur genre, ont des moustaches dont ils se servent pour se diriger dans une pièce. = English: And cats, whatever their gender, have whiskers they use to find their way around a room. ### French: Je ne suis pas sûr que ces canards vont aimer notre vieux pain = English:
column2: I'm not sure these ducks are going to like our old bread.
column3: I'm not sure those ducks will like our old bread.

column1: English: You're the boss! = French: Vous êtes le patron ! ### French: C'est vraiment un bel endroit. = English:
column2: It's really a beautiful place.
column3: It's really a beautiful place. = French: C'est vraiment un bel endroit.

column1: French: Vous avez beaucoup voyagé ! = English: You've travelled a lot! ### French: Je me demande ce qui a bien pu se passer, nous nous sommes peut-être trompées sur la commande .... = English:
column2: I wonder what could have happened. Perhaps we got the order wrong...
column3: I wonder what happened, we may have been mistaken on the order...

column1: French: Quels fruits tu préfères? = English: What are your favourite fruits? ### French: D'accord. = English:
column2: Ok.
column3: Okay.

column1: English: No idea whatsoever. = French: Pas la moindre idée. ### French: Comptez-vous prendre le volant en sortant ? = English:
column2: Are you planning on driving when you leave here?
column3: Do you plan on driving when you get out?
